page.title: List of tools to create Live USB systems

rev.diff:
Line 9: Line 9:
*[http://aligunduz.org/FUSBi/ FUSBi], based on [[UNetbootin]], downloads distributions endorsed as 'free' by the [[Free Software Foundation|FSF]].
*[http://aligunduz.org/FUSBi/ FUSBi], based on [[UNetbootin]], downloads distributions endorsed as 'free' by the [[Free Software Foundation|FSF]].
*[http://rudd-o.com/new-projects/portablelinux Portable Linux] installs any Linux distribution that has a live CD (not DVD) created by Casper, offers data persistence, and runs only on Linux.
*[http://rudd-o.com/new-projects/portablelinux Portable Linux] installs any Linux distribution that has a live CD (not DVD) created by Casper, offers data persistence, and runs only on Linux.
â
*[[cd2usb]], windows tool to create Live USBs of Ubuntu and [[Super OS]] (already included in Super OS)
+
*[[cd2usb]], windows tool to create Live USBs of Ubuntu and [[Super OS]]
*The [[puredyne]] project provides a script ''make-live-device.sh'' which creates a Live USB system from an ISO image.
*The [[puredyne]] project provides a script ''make-live-device.sh'' which creates a Live USB system from an ISO image.
*[https://launchpad.net/win32-image-writer Win32 Disk Imager] (aka Image Writer for Windows), recommended by [[Arch Linux]] and [[Moblin]]
*[https://launchpad.net/win32-image-writer Win32 Disk Imager] (aka Image Writer for Windows), recommended by [[Arch Linux]] and [[Moblin]]
